&nbsp; &nbsp; ITEM&nbsp;5.07 Submission of Matters to a Vote of Security Holders On May&nbsp;6, 2017, Berkshire Hathaway Inc. held an annual meeting of its shareholders. The agenda items for the meeting along with the vote of the Company&#146;s Class&nbsp;A and Class B common shareholders voting together as a single class with respect to each of the agenda items are shown below. There were six items acted on at that meeting as follows: 1)&nbsp;Election of Directors; 2)&nbsp;A non-binding resolution to approve the compensation of Berkshire&#146;s Named Executive Officers; 3)&nbsp;A non-binding resolution to determine the frequency with which shareholders shall be entitled to have an advisory vote on executive compensation; 4)&nbsp;a shareholder proposal with respect to the disclosure of Berkshire&#146;s policies and procedures for making political contributions and the reporting of political contributions; 5)&nbsp;a shareholder proposal requesting the issuance of a report with respect to Berkshire&#146;s policies, plans and actions to measure, monitor, mitigate, disclose and set quantitative reduction targets for methane emissions resulting from all operations; and 6)&nbsp;a shareholder proposal requiring that Berkshire divest its holdings in companies involved in the extracting, processing, and/or burning of fossil fuels within 12 years. Berkshire&#146;s shareholders reelected all of Berkshire&#146;s directors in an uncontested election. Following are the votes cast for and against each director.
